intro: Cubeba miniata, commonly known as wild ginger, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, white to yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the ginger family, Zingiberaceae, and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its rhizomes are used in traditional medicine for their purported therapeutic properties. The botanical features of Cubeba miniata make it a valuable species in both horticulture and herbal applications.
